definition: old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]

sentences.english: John's about to start a nine-week national speaking tour.
sentences.chinese: 约翰即将展开一场历时九周的全国巡回演讲。

sentences.english: Could it reverse a two-decade decline in economic and social progress?
sentences.chinese: 它是否能够扭转历时二十年的经济和社会倒退？

sentences.english: The first chapter is the analysis of compound words featuring presentation of the plereme.
sentences.chinese: 第二章，义素外现类复合名词的历时研究。

sentences.english: Reduction is a trend of language diachronic evolvement.
sentences.chinese: 简约是语言历时演变的一种趋势。

sentences.english: The first chapter from a macro perspective of the "freezing" the birth of social background.
sentences.chinese: 第二章从历时性的角度对《冰点》作品进行文本分析。

sentences.english: The argument over self-rule is long.
sentences.chinese: 这场关于自治的争论历时长久。

sentences.english: The dynasty lasted more than two hundred years until Wang Mang usurped the throne of Emperor Xiao Ping.
sentences.chinese: 汉朝历时两百余年，到了孝平皇帝，被王莽篡了位。

sentences.english: The victory took five rounds of voting over five days.
sentences.chinese: 该胜利经历了历时五天的五轮投票。

sentences.english: Keep wy from eyes, lips nd mouth.
sentences.chinese: 施历时避开眼部唇部和口部。

sentences.english: This magnum opus took ten years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 这部巨著历时十年方始告成。

sentences.english: Kant criticized the metaphysical dogmatism both in synchronic and diachronic way.
sentences.chinese: 康德从历时和共时两方面理性批判了形而上学独断论。

sentences.english: His appeal took 14 years but this case is totally different.
sentences.chinese: 他的上诉历时14年，但这起案件截然不同。

sentences.english: Total solar eclipse to come, longest in 500 years.
sentences.chinese: 日全食历时最长的一次是百年难遇。

sentences.english: The regulations have taken more than five years to draft.
sentences.chinese: 这一条例起草时间历时五年之久。

sentences.english: During the 9 months are not good, or lost the last five days of azithromycin to do.
sentences.chinese: 历时9个月都没有好，最后还是输了5天阿奇才好的。

sentences.english: All right. I need to come back to synchrony and diachrony.
sentences.chinese: 好，现在我们回到了语言的同步分析和历时分析上。

definition: time-consuming/to take a period of (x amount of time)
to extend as long as/to lengthen out to
(to be done) by (a certain date)/lasting (a certain time)
separated in time (usu. followed by a quantity of time)
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to span/to stretch across/to travel across
